title: 'Big mistake': Barr, White House officials tried to keep Trump from getting involved in Stone's sentencing
content: WASHINGTON — White House officials offering clemency Roger Stone outraged President Donald Trump 's decision Friday night people familiar matter told NBC News Among opposed Trump 's decision spare longtime adviser report prison next week White House chief staff Mark Meadows according person familiar situation Multiple White House officials even advised president commutation according second source opposition fueled concerns Trump could face significant political blowback could seen abusing presidential power — risk president afford take continues trail former Vice President Joe Biden national polls key battle ground states raising red flags re-election chances Attorney General William Barr discussed Stone 's sentence Trump recommended clemency offered according multiple sources White House officials including Meadows also advised president commutation site protected recaptcha Privacy Policy Terms Service Trump warned vulnerabilities according one people familiar discussions said president told “ big mistake ” asked president would flout advice top advisers one sources said president believed Stone treated unfairly prosecutors Russia investigation illegitimate “ witch hunt ” Trump 's decision ignore advice arounds also rooted president 's belief base would disapprove decision commute Stone “ senior advisers around telling base wants build wall drain swamp never said 'pardon Roger Stone ” according one sources announcement Stone 's clemency sparked concern among viewed emblematic lack control close president Trump 's decision making process including legal team asked Saturday n't take Barr 's advice cautioning granting Stone clemency Trump said Well n't say attorney general week two ago made statement long anybody knew going White House announced Friday evening Trump commuted prison sentence Stone former campaign aide sparing longtime adviser report prison next week Stone sentenced February three years four months federal prison obstructing congressional investigation Russia 's presidential election meddling coronavirus pandemic swept nation given extension reporting prison home confinement Ft. Lauderdale Florida Stone calling pardon clemency social media weeks Trump little dissuade lobbying efforts repeatedly telling reporters something considering Trump hinted clemency pardon works retweeted petition pardon Stone end June
